DOC.brief_summary: Do Back School and/or supervise walk improve report pain spine flexibility sedentary woman chronic low back pain ( LBP ) ?
DOC.brief_title: Effect Back School Supervised Walking Sedentary Women With Chronic Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: From August 2002 March 2004 , one hundred nineteen volunteer sedentary woman chronic LBP age range 32 60 year old , randomly allocate four group participant assign Back School ( BS ; N=28 ) , Supervised Walking ( W ; N=32 ) , Back School Supervised Walking ( BS+W ; N=29 ) , Control Group ( CG ; N=30 ) submit intervention week 5 consecutive week follow 6 month . The group BS , W , BS+W receive LBP-targeted lecture on-place practical session respective intervention . CG receive print information LBP 5 different lecture unrelated LBP .
DOC.criteria: Age range 30 60 year old LBP without know organic cause least 3 month duration Less 90 minute per week regular physical activity intensity Any known organic cause LBP
